By Lisa Shock on Saturday, April 28, 2007 - 06:53 pm:

My experimental monster is now 1y 4mo old!

By Blackish_ on Saturday, April 28, 2007 - 06:57 pm:

Just thinking... Have you ever recorded vids of all the fights in the tourney and uploaded them on you tube? Would be alot of work, but definately awesome.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, April 28, 2007 - 09:18 pm:

Youtube didn't exist when we had tourneys. Also, it IS a lot of work. Each round of an event is best 3/5 battles, meaning that each square on a bracket can take 5-6 battles to decide (6th is a tie-breaker in rare cases). On the standard 4x4 grid you wind up with up to 72 individual battles comprising an event.

By Blackish_ on Saturday, April 28, 2007 - 09:28 pm:

Yeah, way too much work. Just thinking...

Maybe recording a match deciding which monster wins the whole tourney. Again, just thinking...

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, April 28, 2007 - 09:46 pm:

You often don't know when that is happening. We usually run all of one monster's events, then move on to the next two, following the grid. Many times the first monster out wins all 3 of it's rounds before the others have finished, and it isn't til you're done that you know that monster #1 took the event.

Occasionally there will be a final tiebreaker, but, that's rare. The tie-breakers are usually a set of 5 matches of each of the tied monsters against a known standard monster like Bones, not each other. So, they are 10 rounds.

By mepersoner on Monday, April 30, 2007 - 04:48 am:

Something more like this would be more possible with an elimination or double elimination tournament. Just the last match could be done.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 30, 2007 - 09:53 am:

True, however, many people don't view eliminations as really fair. Plus, since you never get to face everyone's monster, people don't get as involved in rivalries.

Doesn't everyone want the opportunity to hand, oh say, meep, his monster's tushie on a platter?

By mepersoner on Monday, April 30, 2007 - 03:05 pm:

Lisa you've made the mistake of thinking such a possibility exists.

By Blackish_ on Monday, April 30, 2007 - 05:46 pm:

Lol, maybe someday. It's all up to the tourney host.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, May 2, 2007 - 07:46 pm:

There was a guy who tried it, his event never really got off the ground because no one wanted to enter. People really like the idea of having their monster battle everyone else's.

BTW, we need to decide on an official tie-breaker monster. Is Science ok?

By Capt. Brainpan on Monday, October 1, 2007 - 06:32 pm:

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 12:37 pm:

I can try to post something, it's dificult, because an important or deciding match might actually be fought very early on. Saving all of the rounds is a huge project.

People who haven't competed may not realize that the in-game events are usually set up so that the tougher opponents show up near the end of an event. There's no way to know what might happen in a RL event.
